<div id="block-views-courses-block" class="clearfix block block-views well">     <h2>Featured Course</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-block view-dom-id-308717ae805f933c8387b6a7710dbe24">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-image">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <div>        <div>ENGLISH 244</div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-244">101 Years of London</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><p>101 Years of London juxtaposes older representations of the UK's capital city (from Defoe, Dickens, Woolf and others) with contemporary accounts (from Zadie Smith, Ian McEwen and others). We will also look at films, painting, photography and websites about London.</p>
</div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-view-node">        <span class="field-content more-link"><a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-244">See Course Information</a></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div>
</div>

                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Current Courses </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-current_courses_page view-dom-id-dcf3e486a84db575cc10633826a9b86f">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">

          <tr class="odd views-row-first">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            ENGLISH 9CT (section 1)<br /><a href="/courses/2017-2018-english-9ct">Special Topics in Creative Expression</a><br /><strong></strong>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person" >
            <a href="/people/kai-carlson-wee">Kai Carlson-Wee</a>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2017-2018 Autumn          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow" >
            <div>Monday Wednesday</div> <div>3:30pm - 5:20pm</div> <div>460-334</div> <div><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/courses/syllabus/kai-syllabus-fire_stories_eng_9ct_fall_2017.pdf">Download Syllabus</a></div>          </td>
              </tr>

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-3c9ac4f6baecf975bdf2a1d153d0b3ba">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

  <div id="block-menu-block-4" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Main menu</h2>

    <div id="main-content-wrapper" class="main-content-wrapper">
      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> On the Road: American Travel Films </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10560" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-131b" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="On the Road: American Travel Films" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><span>For more than a century, cars and cinema have occupied a romantic place in the American imagination, as vehicles that can take us someplace new, or engines for our fantasies of mobility, freedom and personal expression. Perhaps this is one reason why the road movie is one of the most enduring subgenres of twentieth-century film. In this class, we¿ll watch ten classic American travel films, one for each decade starting from Buster Keaton¿s silent Go West (1925) and arriving at Christopher Nolan¿s space epic Interstellar (2014). We thus begin on a train and end on a spaceship. In between we¿ll travel by car, bus, motorcycle and even on foot across America and beyond, in search of answers to the motivating questions for this course: what is the attraction of the open road, and how is the romance of its call embraced and challenged by the multiple genres of these films, the concerns of the decades in which they were produced, and the limits they impose on the idea of unrestricted travel, individual growth and independence.</span></p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">131B</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH131B">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 070</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-section_info view-dom-id-fb9a1b266572614c40943b1cb4567f77">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-4" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title"  scope="col">

              </tr>
    </thead>

          <tr class="odd views-row-first views-row-last">

            ENGLISH 131B (section 1)<br /><strong>On the Road: American Travel Films</strong><br /><strong></strong>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person" >
            <a href="/people/luke-barnhart">Luke Barnhart</a>          </td>

                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow" >

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">

              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> On the Road: American Travel Films </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10560" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-131b" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="On the Road: American Travel Films" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><span>For more than a century, cars and cinema have occupied a romantic place in the American imagination, as vehicles that can take us someplace new, or engines for our fantasies of mobility, freedom and personal expression. Perhaps this is one reason why the road movie is one of the most enduring subgenres of twentieth-century film. In this class, we¿ll watch ten classic American travel films, one for each decade starting from Buster Keaton¿s silent Go West (1925) and arriving at Christopher Nolan¿s space epic Interstellar (2014). We thus begin on a train and end on a spaceship. In between we¿ll travel by car, bus, motorcycle and even on foot across America and beyond, in search of answers to the motivating questions for this course: what is the attraction of the open road, and how is the romance of its call embraced and challenged by the multiple genres of these films, the concerns of the decades in which they were produced, and the limits they impose on the idea of unrestricted travel, individual growth and independence.</span></p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">131B</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH131B">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 070</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> On the Road: American Travel Films </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10560" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-131b" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="On the Road: American Travel Films" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><span>For more than a century, cars and cinema have occupied a romantic place in the American imagination, as vehicles that can take us someplace new, or engines for our fantasies of mobility, freedom and personal expression. Perhaps this is one reason why the road movie is one of the most enduring subgenres of twentieth-century film. In this class, we¿ll watch ten classic American travel films, one for each decade starting from Buster Keaton¿s silent Go West (1925) and arriving at Christopher Nolan¿s space epic Interstellar (2014). We thus begin on a train and end on a spaceship. In between we¿ll travel by car, bus, motorcycle and even on foot across America and beyond, in search of answers to the motivating questions for this course: what is the attraction of the open road, and how is the romance of its call embraced and challenged by the multiple genres of these films, the concerns of the decades in which they were produced, and the limits they impose on the idea of unrestricted travel, individual growth and independence.</span></p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">131B</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH131B">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 070</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Historical Fiction: Bringing the Past to Life in Text and Film </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10550" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-134a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Historical Fiction: Bringing the Past to Life in Text and Film" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>How does the past come to life, on the page and on the screen? From Walter Scott, to Toni Morrison, to the popular romances, films, and television series of today, this course considers a range of texts that draw their settings, characters, and plots from history. We will examine how each work addresses some of the central tensions of historical fiction: between the imagined past and the past as reconstructed through research, between description and the spirit of the past, between accuracy and relevance. Our focus will be on the craft of historical fiction and the power of techniques like description, dialogue, setting, and character to reanimate the past. For the final assessment, students will choose between a traditional argumentative paper and a historical story of their own invention.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">134A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH134A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 069</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

  <!-- /#main-menu -->
    <div id="main" class="clearfix main" role="main">
    <div id="main-top-wrapper" class="main-top-wrapper">
                                        </div>
    <div id="main-content-wrapper" class="main-content-wrapper">
      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Historical Fiction: Bringing the Past to Life in Text and Film </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10550" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-134a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Historical Fiction: Bringing the Past to Life in Text and Film" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>How does the past come to life, on the page and on the screen? From Walter Scott, to Toni Morrison, to the popular romances, films, and television series of today, this course considers a range of texts that draw their settings, characters, and plots from history. We will examine how each work addresses some of the central tensions of historical fiction: between the imagined past and the past as reconstructed through research, between description and the spirit of the past, between accuracy and relevance. Our focus will be on the craft of historical fiction and the power of techniques like description, dialogue, setting, and character to reanimate the past. For the final assessment, students will choose between a traditional argumentative paper and a historical story of their own invention.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">134A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH134A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 069</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Historical Fiction: Bringing the Past to Life in Text and Film </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10550" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-134a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Historical Fiction: Bringing the Past to Life in Text and Film" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>How does the past come to life, on the page and on the screen? From Walter Scott, to Toni Morrison, to the popular romances, films, and television series of today, this course considers a range of texts that draw their settings, characters, and plots from history. We will examine how each work addresses some of the central tensions of historical fiction: between the imagined past and the past as reconstructed through research, between description and the spirit of the past, between accuracy and relevance. Our focus will be on the craft of historical fiction and the power of techniques like description, dialogue, setting, and character to reanimate the past. For the final assessment, students will choose between a traditional argumentative paper and a historical story of their own invention.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">134A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH134A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 069</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even views-row-last views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/social-imperative-race-close-reading-and-contemporary-literary-criticism"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37302" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/inprint_moya.jpg?itok=APQgLIad" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/social-imperative-race-close-reading-and-contemporary-literary-criticism">The Social Imperative: Race, Close Reading, and Contemporary Literary Criticism</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
      <div class="view-footer">
      <p><a class="btn" href="https://english.stanford.edu/bookshelf">Explore the Bookshelf</a></p>    </div>

  <div id="block-search-form" class="clearfix block block-search" role="search">       <div class="content"> <form action="/courses/2016-2017-english-146a" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">

      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A) </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10236" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-146a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-image" class="postcard-image group-s-postcard-image field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-square/public/steinbeck.jpg?itok=mm83E3yl" width="270" height="270" alt="" /></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Introduction to the work of an American writer, beloved by general readers, often reviled by critics, whose career spanned from the Great Depression through World War II to the social upheavals of the 1960s. Focus on the social and political contexts of Steinbeck's major works; his fascination with California and Mexico; his interdisciplinary interest in marine biology and in philosophy; his diverse experiments with literary form, including drama and film.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">146A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH146A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">218 049</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-section_info view-dom-id-e236ea1d11799e8b26fb71ae7e413969">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-4" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title"  scope="col">
            <a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-146a?order=title&amp;sort=asc" title="sort by Title" class="active">Title</a>          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person"  scope="col">
            Instructor          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year"  scope="col">
            Quarter          </th>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow"  scope="col">
            Day, Time, Location          </th>
              </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
          <tr class="odd views-row-first views-row-last">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title" >
            ENGLISH 146A (section 1)<br /><strong>Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A)</strong><br /><strong></strong>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person" >
            <a href="/people/gavin-jones">Gavin Jones</a>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2016-2017 Spring          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow" >
            <div>Tuesday Thursday</div><div>1:30pm - 2:50pm</div><div>McMurtry102</div><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/courses/syllabus/steinbeck_english_amstud_146a.pdf">Download Syllabus</a>          </td>

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

</div></a></div>  </div>

                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A) </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10236" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-146a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-image" class="postcard-image group-s-postcard-image field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-square/public/steinbeck.jpg?itok=mm83E3yl" width="270" height="270" alt="" /></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Introduction to the work of an American writer, beloved by general readers, often reviled by critics, whose career spanned from the Great Depression through World War II to the social upheavals of the 1960s. Focus on the social and political contexts of Steinbeck's major works; his fascination with California and Mexico; his interdisciplinary interest in marine biology and in philosophy; his diverse experiments with literary form, including drama and film.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">146A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH146A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">218 049</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/rasberry-book.jpg?itok=pOjzfnaf" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/or-orwell-writing-and-democratic-socialism"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37300" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/inprint_woloch.jpg?itok=-PO3dLCs" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/or-orwell-writing-and-democratic-socialism">Or Orwell: Writing and Democratic Socialism</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/writing-america-literary-landmarks-walden-pond-wounded-knee-readers-companion"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37243" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/shelley.png?itok=vLIofX2z" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/writing-america-literary-landmarks-walden-pond-wounded-knee-readers-companion">Writing America: Literary Landmarks from Walden Pond to Wounded Knee (A Reader&#039;s Companion)</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even views-row-last views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/social-imperative-race-close-reading-and-contemporary-literary-criticism"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37302" typeof="">

<body class="html not-front not-logged-in no-sidebars page-node page-node- page-node-10236 node-type-stanford-course       " >

    <a href="#main-nav" class="element-invisible element-focusable">Skip to navigation</a>

  <div id="global-header">
    <div class="container">
      <div class="row-fluid">
        <div id="top-logo" class="span4"><a href="http://www.stanford.edu"><img src="/sites/default/themes/english/images/header-stanford-logo@2x.png" alt="Stanford University"></a></div>
                <div id="top-menu" class="span8"><div class="region region-global-header clearfix">
  <div id="block-webauth-webauth-login-block" class="clearfix block block-webauth">     <h2>WebAuth Login</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div id="webauth_login_url">
  <a class="button" href="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/webauth/login?destination=node/10236%3Forder%3Dtitle%26sort%3Ddesc">SUNetID Login</a>

</div>
              </div>
    </div>
  </div>
  <!-- /#global-header -->
  <div id="header" class="clearfix header" role="banner">
    <div class="container">
      <div class="row">
        <div class="span8">
                    <div id="logo" class=" site-logo"> <a href="/" title="Home" rel="home"> <img src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/themes/english/logo.png" alt="Stanford" role="presentation"> </a></div>
                    <!-- /#logo -->
                              <div id="site" class="hide">
            <div id="name"><a href="/">Department of English</a></div>
          </div>
                    <!-- /#name-and-slogan -->
                    <div id="header-content" class="row-fluid header-content"><div class="region region-header clearfix">

        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A) </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10236" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-146a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Steinbeck (AMSTUD 146A)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-image" class="postcard-image group-s-postcard-image field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-square/public/steinbeck.jpg?itok=mm83E3yl" width="270" height="270" alt="" /></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Introduction to the work of an American writer, beloved by general readers, often reviled by critics, whose career spanned from the Great Depression through World War II to the social upheavals of the 1960s. Focus on the social and political contexts of Steinbeck's major works; his fascination with California and Mexico; his interdisciplinary interest in marine biology and in philosophy; his diverse experiments with literary form, including drama and film.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">146A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH146A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">218 049</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-section_info view-dom-id-14717998ac137251a63602ee02d4bdc4">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-4" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title active"  scope="col">

                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person"  scope="col">

              </tr>
    </thead>

          <tr class="odd views-row-first views-row-last">

                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">

</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>

              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Speaking of Baseball (AMSTUD 147A) </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10554" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-147a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Speaking of Baseball (AMSTUD 147A)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><table><tbody><tr><td>Since its invention in the nineteenth century, baseball has been steeped in lore and rhetoric. A cultural commentator recently pegged it one of three significant American contributions to world culture, along with jazz and the U.S. constitution. Literary and artistic representations of baseball abound, often treating it as more than a game and only a little less than a religion. In this class, we¹ll track representations and grand claims made for baseball by American poets, novelists, and commentators of all sorts. We'll weigh the cornucopia of literary nonfiction depicting the game. The goal will be to map the scope of this literature, defining a tradition's edges, determining its peaks, assessing its limits, challenges, and stakes.</td>
		</tr></tbody></table><p> </p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">147A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH147A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 071</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/rasberry-book.jpg?itok=pOjzfnaf" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/or-orwell-writing-and-democratic-socialism"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37300" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/inprint_woloch.jpg?itok=-PO3dLCs" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/or-orwell-writing-and-democratic-socialism">Or Orwell: Writing and Democratic Socialism</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/writing-america-literary-landmarks-walden-pond-wounded-knee-readers-companion"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37243" typeof="">

  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/writing-america-literary-landmarks-walden-pond-wounded-knee-readers-companion">Writing America: Literary Landmarks from Walden Pond to Wounded Knee (A Reader&#039;s Companion)</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even views-row-last views-align-center">

<body class="html not-front not-logged-in no-sidebars page-node page-node- page-node-10554 node-type-stanford-course       " >
    <div id="wrap" > <a href="#main" class="element-invisible element-focusable">Skip to content</a>
    <a href="#main-nav" class="element-invisible element-focusable">Skip to navigation</a>
    <!-- /#skipnav -->
    <!-- /#admin-shortcuts -->
  <div id="global-header">
    <div class="container">
      <div class="row-fluid">
        <div id="top-logo" class="span4"><a href="http://www.stanford.edu"><img src="/sites/default/themes/english/images/header-stanford-logo@2x.png" alt="Stanford University"></a></div>
                <div id="top-menu" class="span8"><div class="region region-global-header clearfix">

    <div id="main-content-wrapper" class="main-content-wrapper">
      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Speaking of Baseball (AMSTUD 147A) </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10554" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-147a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Speaking of Baseball (AMSTUD 147A)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><table><tbody><tr><td>Since its invention in the nineteenth century, baseball has been steeped in lore and rhetoric. A cultural commentator recently pegged it one of three significant American contributions to world culture, along with jazz and the U.S. constitution. Literary and artistic representations of baseball abound, often treating it as more than a game and only a little less than a religion. In this class, we¹ll track representations and grand claims made for baseball by American poets, novelists, and commentators of all sorts. We'll weigh the cornucopia of literary nonfiction depicting the game. The goal will be to map the scope of this literature, defining a tradition's edges, determining its peaks, assessing its limits, challenges, and stakes.</td>
		</tr></tbody></table><p> </p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">147A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH147A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 071</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-section_info view-dom-id-cab127cf77e96736c4164da022436bb0">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-4" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title active"  scope="col">

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Speaking of Baseball (AMSTUD 147A) </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10554" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-147a" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Speaking of Baseball (AMSTUD 147A)" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><table><tbody><tr><td>Since its invention in the nineteenth century, baseball has been steeped in lore and rhetoric. A cultural commentator recently pegged it one of three significant American contributions to world culture, along with jazz and the U.S. constitution. Literary and artistic representations of baseball abound, often treating it as more than a game and only a little less than a religion. In this class, we¹ll track representations and grand claims made for baseball by American poets, novelists, and commentators of all sorts. We'll weigh the cornucopia of literary nonfiction depicting the game. The goal will be to map the scope of this literature, defining a tradition's edges, determining its peaks, assessing its limits, challenges, and stakes.</td>
		</tr></tbody></table><p> </p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">147A</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH147A">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 071</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-section_info view-dom-id-140db7fb5b4b96252f5e62c4b85a4161">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-4" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title active"  scope="col">

                  <th class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-person"  scope="col">

            <div class="container">
                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">

</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>

    <div id="main-content-wrapper" class="main-content-wrapper">
      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Queer Poetry in America </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10552" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-150j" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Queer Poetry in America" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p><span>Some poets are known for portraying alternative sexualities in their poetry. Others seem to cover sexuality up. Can we use a poem to determine whether a poet is gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, or questioning? Or do some poets simply defy categorization? What makes a poem queer? Is poetry somehow more or less queer than other literary forms? Even if we can answer these questions, what would they tell us about literature in general? This course will investigate such topics and more by tracking queer poetry in twentieth-century America. We’ll start with nineteenth-century figures Walt Whitman and Emily Dickinson, then move on to Gertrude Stein, Hart Crane, Langston Hughes, Countee Cullen, Elizabeth Bishop, Allen Ginsberg, Frank O’Hara, and others. We’ll ask what their poetry meant in their own times, as well as what it means to us in our present era of expanding civil rights and changing sexual attitudes.</span></p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">150J</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH150J">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 066</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
