      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Fiction Writing </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10562" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-90v-0" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Fiction Writing" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Online workshop course that explores the ways in which writers of fiction have used language to examine the world, to create compelling characters, and to move readers. We will begin by studying a selection of stories that demonstrate the many techniques writers use to create fictional worlds; we'll use these stories as models for writing exercises and short assignments, leading to a full story draft.  We will study figurative language, character and setting development, and dramatic structure, among other elements of story craft. Then, each student will submit a full draft and receive feedback from the instructor and his/her classmates.  This course is taught entirely online, but retains the feel of a traditional classroom.  Optional synchronous elements such as discussion and virtual office hours provide the student direct interaction with both the instructor and his/her classmates.  Feedback on written work, both offered to and given by the student, is essential to the course and creates class rapport.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">90V</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH90V">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">216 886</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

  <div id="block-menu-block-4" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2>Main menu</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-4 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-1">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-435"><a href="/">Home</a></li>

      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Fiction Writing </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10562" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-90v-0" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Fiction Writing" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Online workshop course that explores the ways in which writers of fiction have used language to examine the world, to create compelling characters, and to move readers. We will begin by studying a selection of stories that demonstrate the many techniques writers use to create fictional worlds; we'll use these stories as models for writing exercises and short assignments, leading to a full story draft.  We will study figurative language, character and setting development, and dramatic structure, among other elements of story craft. Then, each student will submit a full draft and receive feedback from the instructor and his/her classmates.  This course is taught entirely online, but retains the feel of a traditional classroom.  Optional synchronous elements such as discussion and virtual office hours provide the student direct interaction with both the instructor and his/her classmates.  Feedback on written work, both offered to and given by the student, is essential to the course and creates class rapport.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">90V</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH90V">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">216 886</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Creative Nonfiction </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10194" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-91" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Creative Nonfiction" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>(Formerly 94A.) Historical and contemporary as a broad genre including travel and nature writing, memoir, biography, journalism, and the personal essay. Students use creative means to express factual content.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">91</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH91">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ger field-type-text field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Requirements:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">WAY-A-II, WAY-CE</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">204 819</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

            2016-2017 Spring          </td>

              </tr>

                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">

</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>

                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Creative Nonfiction </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10194" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-91" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Creative Nonfiction" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>(Formerly 94A.) Historical and contemporary as a broad genre including travel and nature writing, memoir, biography, journalism, and the personal essay. Students use creative means to express factual content.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">91</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH91">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ger field-type-text field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Requirements:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">WAY-A-II, WAY-CE</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">204 819</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>

            <a href="/people/nicholas-friedman">Nicholas Friedman</a>          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2016-2017 Summer          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow" >
            <div>Tuesday Thursday</div><div>1:30pm - 3:20pm</div><div>20-21G</div><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/courses/syllabus/eng91_syllabus_-_friedman.docx">Download Syllabus</a>          </td>
              </tr>
      </tbody>
</table>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div></div>
 <!-- /.region -->

                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">

                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Creative Nonfiction </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10194" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-91" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Creative Nonfiction" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>(Formerly 94A.) Historical and contemporary as a broad genre including travel and nature writing, memoir, biography, journalism, and the personal essay. Students use creative means to express factual content.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">91</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH91">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ger field-type-text field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Requirements:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">WAY-A-II, WAY-CE</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">204 819</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>

                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-section-year" >
            2016-2017 Summer          </td>
                  <td class="views-field views-field-field-s-course-dow" >
            <div>Tuesday Thursday</div><div>1:30pm - 3:20pm</div><div>20-21G</div><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/courses/syllabus/eng91_syllabus_-_friedman.docx">Download Syllabus</a>          </td>
              </tr>
      </tbody>
</table>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div></div>

    <div id="main-lower-wrapper" class="main-lower-wrapper">
            <div class="container">
                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">
  <div class="content">

</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>

      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Creative Expression in Writing </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10568" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-9cv" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Creative Expression in Writing" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Online workshop whose primary focus is to give students a skill set to tap into their own creativity. Opportunities for students to explore their creative strengths, develop a vocabulary with which to discuss their own creativity, and experiment with the craft and adventure of their own writing. Students will come out of the course strengthened in their ability to identify and pursue their own creative interests. For undergrads only.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">9CV</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH9CV">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 094</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-d197c0cf1a12635a0d6a81a16dac8617">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

    <div id="main-content-wrapper" class="main-content-wrapper">
      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Creative Expression in Writing </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10568" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-9cv" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Creative Expression in Writing" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Online workshop whose primary focus is to give students a skill set to tap into their own creativity. Opportunities for students to explore their creative strengths, develop a vocabulary with which to discuss their own creativity, and experiment with the craft and adventure of their own writing. Students will come out of the course strengthened in their ability to identify and pursue their own creative interests. For undergrads only.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">9CV</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH9CV">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 094</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-courses-section-info" class="clearfix block block-views">     <h2>Section Information</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-section_info view-dom-id-4ab493e04a0878dc9c5c29f16c8f0ed9">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
      <table class="views-table cols-4" >
         <thead>
      <tr>
                  <th class="views-field views-field-title active"  scope="col">

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

      <div class="container">
        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Creative Expression in Writing </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-10568" class="node node-stanford-course clearfix" about="/courses/2016-2017-english-9cv" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Creative Expression in Writing" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p>Online workshop whose primary focus is to give students a skill set to tap into their own creativity. Opportunities for students to explore their creative strengths, develop a vocabulary with which to discuss their own creativity, and experiment with the craft and adventure of their own writing. Students will come out of the course strengthened in their ability to identify and pursue their own creative interests. For undergrads only.</p>
</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-coursenum-group" class="course-number summary group-coursenum-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-code field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">9CV</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-subject field-type-text field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">ENGLISH</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-course-full-group-morelink-group" class="more-link group-morelink-group field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-ec-link field-type-link-field field-label-above"><div class="field-label">ExploreCourses Link:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://explorecourses.stanford.edu/search?view=catalog&amp;filter-coursestatus-Active=on&amp;q=ENGLISH9CV">View this course and available sections on ExploreCourses</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-course-id field-type-number-integer field-label-above"><div class="field-label">Course ID:&nbsp;</div><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even">219 094</div></div></div>  </div>
  <ul class="links inline"><li class="comment_forbidden first last"></li>
</ul>  </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                              <div id="content-lower" class="row-fluid content-lower"> <div class="region region-content-lower clearfix">

  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-fef05a751ae62327d6597ce8a32ab7c5">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

<div id="block-menu-menu-degrees-and-courses" class="clearfix block block-menu span2">     <h2>Degrees and Courses</h2>
      <div class="content"> <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/english/degree-programs/undergraduate" title="">Undergraduate Program</a></li>

      <div class="view-content">

<div id="block-views-courses-block" class="clearfix block block-views well">     <h2>Featured Course</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-block view-dom-id-9306e879d6d0730bb61af6734ee1103d">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-image">        <div class="field-content"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/3-col-well-header/public/_44984.jpg?itok=OULDuKIU" width="230" height="115" alt="" /></div>  </div>  
  <div>        <div>ENGLISH 76</div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-76">After the Apocalypse</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><p>What happens after the world, as we know it, has ended? In the course of examining classic and newer speculative fictional narratives detailing the ravages of various post-apocalyptic societies and the challenges those societies pose to the survivors, we explore several related questions: What...</div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-view-node">        <span class="field-content more-link"><a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-76">See Course Information</a></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div>
</div>
 <!-- /.region -->
</div>
          </div>
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->

            <div class="container">
                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-b4829d6387b06ddb9d639ce96a83d86c">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/38538" typeof="">

</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>

<div id="block-views-courses-block" class="clearfix block block-views well">     <h2>Featured Course</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="view view-courses view-id-courses view-display-id-block view-dom-id-2a54803bb4ba244a7d34c382271f419e">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-image">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <div>        <div>ENGLISH 244</div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-244">101 Years of London</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-body">        <div class="field-content"><p>101 Years of London juxtaposes older representations of the UK's capital city (from Defoe, Dickens, Woolf and others) with contemporary accounts (from Zadie Smith, Ian McEwen and others). We will also look at films, painting, photography and websites about London.</p>
</div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-view-node">        <span class="field-content more-link"><a href="/courses/2016-2017-english-244">See Course Information</a></span>  </div>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
  
  
</div> </div>
</div>
</div>
 <!-- /.region -->
</div>
          </div>

            <div>Tuesday Thursday</div> <div>3:00pm - 4:50pm</div> <div>Encina West 101</div> <div><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/courses/syllabus/9ce.syllabus.autumn17.pdf">Download Syllabus</a></div>          </td>
              </tr>
          <tr class="even">
                  <td class="views-field views-field-title active" >
            ENGLISH 9CE (section 1)<br /><a href="/courses/2017-2018-english-9ce">Creative Expression in Writing</a><br /><strong></strong>          </td>

            <div class="container">
                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-0c14021a906048162ab5727607afe447">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>
  
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-align-center">

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jumpstart-layouts-2" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2><a href="/degree-programs" class="active-trail">Degree Programs</a></h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="menu-block-wrapper menu-block-stanford_jumpstart_layouts-2 menu-name-main-menu parent-mlid-0 menu-level-2">
  <ul class="menu nav"><li class="first leaf menu-mlid-2001"><a href="/degree-programs/overview-degree-programs">Overview</a></li>
<li class="expanded active-trail active menu-mlid-1411 dropdown-submenu"><a href="/degree-programs/undergraduate-programs" class="active-trail dropdown-toggle active" data-toggle="dropdown" data-target="#">Undergraduate Programs</a><ul class="dropdown-menu"><li class="first leaf has-children menu-mlid-1415"><a href="/degree-programs/undergraduate/major">English Major</a></li>
<li class="leaf menu-mlid-1417"><a href="/degree-programs/undergraduate/minor">English Minor</a></li>

<div id="block-bean-info-for-callout" class="clearfix block block-bean well more-link-stacked">     <h2>Information for Current and Prospective Students</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="entity entity-bean bean-stanford-postcard clearfix" about="/block/info-for-callout" typeof="">

  <div class="content">
    <div id="bean-stanford-postcard-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="bean-stanford-postcard-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-postcard-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Are you a current or prospective student in the Department of English? Visit our info-for pages to learn about advising, download forms, and find other resources pertinent to you.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-postcard-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://sites.stanford.edu/english/information-for/undergraduates" class="more-link">Info for Undergraduates</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/english/information-for/graduates" class="more-link">Info for Ph.D. Students</a></div><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/english/information-for/prospective-graduates" class="more-link">Info for Prospective Ph.D. Students</a></div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
 </div>
</div>
</div>
 <!-- /.region -->
</div>
          </div>
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Undergraduate Programs </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-49" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/degree-programs/undergraduate-programs" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Undergraduate Programs" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p class="summary">To study English is to master the power of language. Literary study also releases our own powers of artistic invention and personal expression, which students can explore in writing courses on fiction, poetry, and the graphic novel.  Fusing criticism and creativity, the English Major is designed to unlock your skills of analysis, verbal communication, and cultural understanding.</p>
<h2>English Major</h2>
<p>Stanford’s English curriculum features a team-taught, yearlong core sequence that traces the big picture of literature’s development from the Middle Ages to the present. English majors also learn critical tools for analyzing literature through three broad course requirements, in poetry, narrative, and methodology. Students gain a contextual framework and are prepared to take the department’s wide range of electives.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate/major">Visit the Major page for information about the major core requirements and emphases.</a></p>
<h2>English Minor</h2>
<p>The minor in English Literature offers some flexibility for those students who want to pursue specific interests within British and American literature, while still requiring certain courses that ensure coverage of a variety of periods, genres, and methods of studying literature.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate/minor">Visit the Minor page for information about the minor requirements and how to declare.</a></p>
<h2>Digital Humanities Minor</h2>
<p>The Digital Humanities minor is Humanities &amp; Sciences' newest minor that combines humanistic inquiry with digital methods and tools to generate new questions and to foster innovative research. Undergraduate students can specialize their studies by selecting one of three emphases --Geospatial Humanities, Quantitative Textual Analysis, or Text Technologies.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://dhminor.stanford.edu/">Visit the Digital Humanities page for information about the minor requirements and how to declare.</a></p>
<h2>CS+English</h2>
<p>The CS+English joint major is a pioneering program that launched in Fall 2014.  In the joint major, you earn a Bachelor of Arts and Science degree by synthesizing core skills from Computer Science and English into an ePortfolio and an integrative senior project.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate-programs/csenglish">Visit the CS+English page for Information about the CS+English joint major and how to participate.</a></p>
<h2>Honors in English</h2>
<p>The Honors Program in English cultivates a lively intellectual environment within which you can test your ideas, germinate sophisticated critical approaches to historical and/or contemporary texts, and build interpretative, analytical and compositional skills that will have a lasting impact on your intellectual and professional life wherever the future takes you.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate/honors">Visit the Honors in English page for information about the Honors requirements and how to apply. </a></p>
<h2>Creative Writing</h2>
<p>Stanford’s Creative Writing Program--one of the best-known in the country--cultivates the power of individual expression within a vibrant community of writers.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate/creative-writing">Visit the Creative Writing page for information about the Creative writing emphasis and minor. </a></p>
<h2>Coterminal MA</h2>
<p>If you are an advanced undergraduate who wants to take the study of literature to a higher level, then the coterminal MA program is for you. You will participate in rigorous graduate-level seminars taught by the department’s renowned faculty.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate/coterminal-ma">Visit the Coterminal page for information on the application and program requirements.</a></p>
<h2>Core Course Descriptions</h2>
<p>Our core curriculum is designed to introduce you to the rich history of literature in English, and to give you the tools to analyze written discourse critically and creatively.  The English core will teach you to think broadly, read closely, and write compellingly.</p>
<p><a class="more-link" href="https://english.stanford.edu/degree-programs/undergraduate/core-course-descriptions">Visit the Core Course Descriptions page for details about what you'll learn in the English core courses.</a></p>
<h2>Contact information</h2>
<p><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/people/blakey-vermeule">Blakey Vermeule</a><br />
	Director of Undergraduate Studies<br /><a href="mailto:vermeule@stanford.edu" rel="nofollow">vermeule@stanford.edu</a><br /><a href="https://calendly.com/vermeule" rel="nofollow">Schedule an appointment</a></p>
<p><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/people/brian-kersey">Brian Kersey</a><br />
	Student Services Specialist<br /><a href="mailto:bkersey@stanford.edu?subject=Inquiry%3A%20Undergraduate%20English%20Programs" rel="nofollow">bkersey@stanford.edu</a></p>
<h2>Social media</h2>
<p>Connect with Stanford English on <a href="https://www.facebook.com/StanfordEnglish" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> and <a href="http://instagram.com/StanfordEnglish" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a>.</p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                                          </div>
            <!-- /#content-wrap --> 
          </div>

                        <div id="main-lower" class="row-fluid main-lower"> <div class="region region-main-lower clearfix">
  <div id="block-views-publications-block-1" class="clearfix block block-views">       <div class="content"> <div class="view view-publications view-id-publications view-display-id-block_1 views-grid-four views-grid-header-footer view-dom-id-068202418b16c60ab9a92b3e0f8f6b1d">
            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/race-and-totalitarian-century-geopolitics-black-literary-imagination">Race and the Totalitarian Century: Geopolitics in the Black Literary Imagination</a></span>  </div>

  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/or-orwell-writing-and-democratic-socialism"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37300" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/inprint_woloch.jpg?itok=-PO3dLCs" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/or-orwell-writing-and-democratic-socialism">Or Orwell: Writing and Democratic Socialism</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd views-align-center">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/writing-america-literary-landmarks-walden-pond-wounded-knee-readers-companion"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37243" typeof="">

    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/shelley.png?itok=vLIofX2z" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/writing-america-literary-landmarks-walden-pond-wounded-knee-readers-companion">Writing America: Literary Landmarks from Walden Pond to Wounded Knee (A Reader&#039;s Companion)</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even views-row-last views-align-center">

        <div id="main-content" class="row main-content">
                    <!-- /#sidebar-first -->
          
          <div id="content" class="mc-content span12">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> CS+English </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-9143" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/csenglish" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="CS+English" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-image" class="postcard-image group-s-postcard-image field-group-div"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-large-scaled field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/36021" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div id="field-collection-item-field-s-image-info-stanford-large-scaled-group-s-image-border-style" class="  group-s-image-border-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/cs_0.jpg?itok=Rn87hROz" width="270" height="140" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p class="summary">Left-brained, right-brained, techie, fuzzy—these are less and less terms for the world or for life. Stanford is excited to be launching a new CS+English joint major for students who want to think across the divide and create projects that fuse science and the humanities. Increasingly, groundbreaking work in literary studies is being done through technology; simultaneously, the world of computer engineering thrives on the creativity and adaptability taught in literature departments. Stanford is uniquely situated to bring together the Bay Area’s rich currents of innovation and imagination, and we are happy to invite you to be the first partners in this new integration of the disciplines.</p>
<h2>Joint Major</h2>
<p>The joint major is not a double major. In a double major, you work along parallel, non-intersecting paths, and are required to take all the credits required for a major in both departments. In the joint major, you integrate the skills of the two disciplines, working with advisors in both departments to craft a project that shows the possibilities of synthesis between literature and CS. The joint major is a new program that works with you to explore and create new work between the disciplines. Because that work is integrated, the credit requirement is significantly less than for the double major.</p>
<p><span>The joint major is a pioneering program not just in the country but in the world. There is, quite possibly, no other place on Earth at this moment where you can pursue an academic experience of this kind and caliber. We are delighted to have a chance to build something new with you in this program.  </span></p>
<h2><span>Structure</span></h2>
<p>The joint major is structured to let you thoughtfully explore and develop your own project at the intersection of CS and literary studies. You declare the major during your sophomore year (latest by the beginning of Autumn of your junior year). All students declaring must complete the <a href="https://stanford.box.com/shared/static/h6erjrj75rercs2gua9z8dm4mgnswqru.pdf" rel="nofollow">CS+English Program Proposal</a>. </p>
<p>Your studies as a joint major begin in your junior year, when it is recommended you create an ePortfolio of reflections, ideas, and work on the interplay between humanities and computer science. Students are encouraged to seek resources on building an ePortfolio in their junior year, as an ePortfolio can parlay the full-fledged capstone project.  In addition to helping you build up a body of work and thinking related to CS+English, building an ePortfolio will introduce you to much of the exciting work in the field being done at Stanford and in the Bay Area. </p>
<p>In your senior year, you will complete a capstone project. This project involves both programming and literary research, and could include such work as digital editions, analyses of corpora, works of electronic literature, digital representations of literary venues, studies of natural language processing as applied to literary analysis, or any other project that draws integrally on both disciplines. <span>All capstone projects must be approved by both the student's Computer Science advisor and English advisor. This project will normally take one quarter, and should be taken concurrently with the Computer Science capstone requirement. In English, students are required to complete 3 units of </span><span>ENGLISH 198. Individual Work</span><span> with a faculty advisor in English as part of the integrative project. In preparation for the Independent Study in English, students must secure an advisor, complete the<a href="https://stanford.box.com/shared/static/hl0zna48liez8u10ulqs.pdf" rel="nofollow"> CS+English Capstone form</a>, and submit a written proposal of the project.</span></p>
<h2><span>Course Requirements</span></h2>
<p class="caption">Students who major in CS+English must complete requirements in all four following categories: the English Core, the Computer Science Foundations, an English Emphasis, and a Computer Science Track. Details for each of these categories are below.</p>
<h3>English Core (33 units)</h3>
<p>Students who major in CS+English must complete all of the following English courses:</p>
<ol><li>
		<p>ENGLISH 160. Poetry and Poetics (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>ENGLISH 161. Narrative and Narrative Theory (5 units)  </p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>One course in the ENGLISH 10 series - Introduction to English I (5 units)  </p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>One course in the ENGLISH 11 series - Introduction to English II (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>One course in the ENGLISH 12 series - Introduction to English III (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>One Pre-1800 Historical Course (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>ENGLISH 198. Individual Work (3 credits) --Units completed for the Integrative Capstone Project.</p>
	</li>
</ol><h3>Computer Science Foundations (minimum of 53 units)</h3>
<p>Students who major in CS+English must complete all of the following courses:</p>
<ol><li>
		<p>MATH 41. Calculus (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>MATH 42. Calculus (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>CS 103. Mathematical Foundations of Computing (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>CS 109. Introduction to Probability for Computer Scientists (5 units)</p>
	</li>
</ol><p>  5.-6. Two additional Math electives (6-15 units total)</p>
<p>  7.   Physics 41. Mechanics (4 units)</p>
<p><span>  8.   Physics 43. Electricity and Magnetism (4 units)</span></p>
<p>  9.   One additional Science elective (3-5 units)</p>
<p>  10. One course in Technology in Society (3-5 units)</p>
<p>  11. CS 106B. Programming Abstractions or 106X. Programming Abstractions (5 units)</p>
<p>  12. ENGR 40. Introductory Electronics (5 units) (E40A and M also allowed)</p>
<p>  13. One Engineering Fundamentals elective (3-4 units)</p>
<h3>English Emphasis (25 units)</h3>
<div>
	<p>Students who major in CS+English must complete five classes in their chosen emphasis in English. Complete requirements for each English emphasis can be found <a href="https://stanford.box.com/shared/static/1nleij6itszidnyuzj4pfna9ls7jaljy.pdf" rel="nofollow">here</a>. </p>
</div>
<h3>Computer Science Track (35-37 units)</h3>
<ol><li>
		<p>CS 107. Computer Organization Systems (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>CS 110. Principles of Computer Systems (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>CS 161. Design and Analysis of Algorithms (5 units)</p>
	</li>
	<li>
		<p>CS191. or CS191W. Senior Project (3 units)</p>
	</li>
</ol><p><span>  5-9. Five </span><span>courses that satisfy a CS Track. These are the first five courses listed under the “Depth/Track and Electives” area on the <a href="http://csmajor.stanford.edu/ProgramSheets.shtml">CS Program Sheet</a>.</span></p>
<p><span>Note: Writing in the Major for CS can be satisfied with either CS181W or CS191W. </span><span>The requirements for the Biocomputation and Computer Engineering Tracks do not follow this pattern. Please see <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofengineering/#jointmajorwithcstext">Explore Degrees</a> for requirements for the Biocomputation and Computer Engineering Tracks.</span></p>
<h3><em>Sample 4-Year Plan</em></h3>
<p class="caption">CS Information Track and English Literature Emphasis. (Assumes no programming experience, no AP credit in Calculus, Physics, or Chemistry.)</p>
<table><thead><tr><th> </th>
			<th>Autumn </th>
			<th>Winter</th>
			<th>Spring</th>
		</tr></thead><tbody><tr><th>
				<p><strong>Freshman  </strong></p>
			</th>
			<td>
				<p>CS106A (5)</p>
				Math 41 (5)</td>
			<td>
				<p>CS106B (5)</p>
				<p>Math 42 (5)</p>
				Physics 41 (5)</td>
			<td>
				<p>CS103 (5)</p>
				<p>CS107 (5)</p>
				Physics 43 (5)</td>
		</tr><tr><th><strong>Sophomore</strong></th>
			<td>
				<p>English 10A (5)</p>
				<p>English 160 (5)</p>
				Math elective (3-5)</td>
			<td>
				<p>English 11C (5)</p>
				<p>English 161 (5)</p>
				<p>CS109 (5)</p>
			</td>
			<td>
				<p>English 12A (5)</p>
				<p>History of literature course (5)</p>
				Engineering 40M (5)</td>
		</tr><tr><th><strong>Junior</strong></th>
			<td>
				<p>English elective (5)</p>
				<p>CS110 (5)</p>
				CS elective (3-5)</td>
			<td>
				<p>English elective (5)</p>
				<p>CS124 (4)</p>
				TIS course (4)</td>
			<td>
				<p>English elective (5)</p>
				CS161 (5)</td>
		</tr><tr><th><strong>Senior</strong></th>
			<td>
				<p>English elective (5)</p>
				<p>CS145 (4)</p>
				<p>CS224W (3)</p>
				Math elective (3-5)</td>
			<td>
				<p>English elective (5)</p>
				<p>CS142 (3)</p>
				Science elective (3-5)</td>
			<td>
				<p>English 198 (3)</p>
				<p>CS191W (3)</p>
				Eng Fund elective (3-4)</td>
		</tr></tbody></table><h2><span>FAQs</span></h2>
<h5>What is the CS+English joint major?</h5>
<p>The CS+English joint major is a new type of undergraduate degree program that allows you to gain mastery in depth of two disciplines, Computer Science and literature, and to demonstrate that mastery through work that integrates computational and literary analysis.</p>
<h5>What degree will I receive?</h5>
<p>Bachelor of Arts and Sciences (BAS) in English and Computer Science.</p>
<h5>How is a joint major different from a double major?</h5>
<p>The joint major integrates the two majors: your central work in the joint major is a project that involves both programming and literary evaluation or research. A double major runs on two different tracks; with the joint major, you bring the tracks together.</p>
<p>Because the joint major works by integrating two majors, you earn the degree with fewer credits than the double major.  In the case of the joint major, both departments have scaled back their required courses to make room for your work between the disciplines.</p>
<h5>How is this different from a major and a minor?</h5>
<p>As with the double major, the key difference is one of integration: the joint major works by synthesizing your work in CS and English, while a major/minor option is basically two tracks. When you minor in a subject, the department you are minoring in aims to give you breadth in the subject; with the joint major, you will get depth in both subjects.</p>
<h5>What is an ePortfolio?</h5>
<p>The ePortfolio is an online collection of your work that features: (1) best assignments from both CS and English, (2) reflections on and revisions of this work, (3) reflections on the crossovers and differences between English and CS, (4) planning and early stages of the integrative capstone work.</p>
<p>In some cases, and with the agreement of your advisors from both departments, an expanded ePortfolio can become the Integrative Capstone Project.</p>
<h5>When can I declare the CS+English joint major?</h5>
<p>Contact us now for details on getting involved. All students must declare this joint major by the beginning of their junior year.</p>
<h5>What is the Integrative Capstone Project?</h5>
<p>The Integrative Capstone Project is defined by its integration of programming and literary evaluation and research. The intersection between CS and English is new and rich, and there are many types of projects to be done. From digital editions to quantitative analysis of corpora to studies of natural language processing as applied to literary analysis, the key to these projects is the synthesis of coding and literary work. Above all, the program looks to you: what project would you like to pursue that synthesizes the two disciplines?</p>
<h5>Can I combine CS+English with one of the “emphases” tracks in English?</h5>
<p>If you are declared as a joint major in CS+English, you may pursue the English and Creative Writing emphasis. However, the English and Foreign Language Literature, English and Philosophy, and Interdisciplinary English emphases are not available with the joint major.</p>
<h5>What happens if I decide to go back to majoring in just English or CS?</h5>
<p>Because the joint major is structured to include most of the requirements for both majors, there is some room for transferring onto a single-major track. It is simply necessary to look at the requirements that have been omitted from the joint major and be sure that you have enough time in your schedule to take these courses. Naturally, talk to your advisors and the Undergraduate Student Services Coordinator about the decision and the process.</p>
<hr /><h3>Resources: </h3>
<p>- Learn more about CS+English on <a href="http://exploredegrees.stanford.edu/schoolofhumanitiesandsciences/english/#jointmajortext">Explore Degrees</a>. </p>
<p>- Learn more about the new joint degree program on <a href="https://undergrad.stanford.edu/academic-planning/majors-minors/joint-majors-csx">Stanford Undergrad</a>.</p>
<p>- <span>Connect with Stanford English on </span><a href="https://facebook.com/StanfordEnglish" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> and <a href="https://instagram.com/stanfordenglish" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a><span>. </span></p>
<h3>Contact Information: </h3>
<p><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/people/alex-woloch">Alex Woloch</a> / <span>English Department Chair / <a href="mailto:woloch@stanford.edu?subject=CS%2BEnglish%20Inquiry" rel="nofollow">woloch@stanford.edu</a> </span></p>
<p><a href="https://english.stanford.edu/people/brian-kersey">Brian Kersey</a> / <span>Student Services Specialist, English / <a href="http://bkersey@stanford.edu">bkersey@stanford.edu</a></span></p>
<p><a href="http://www-cs.stanford.edu/staff">Meredith Hutchin</a> / <span>Student Services Specialist, Computer Science / </span><a href="http://hutchin@cs.stanford.edu">hutchin@cs.stanford.edu</a></p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article>  </div>

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

  <div class="views-field views-field-field-s-image-info">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/social-imperative-race-close-reading-and-contemporary-literary-criticism"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-profile field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37302" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-profile/public/inprint_moya.jpg?itok=APQgLIad" width="100" height="130" alt="" /></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></a></div>  </div>  
  <div class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/bookshelf/social-imperative-race-close-reading-and-contemporary-literary-criticism">The Social Imperative: Race, Close Reading, and Contemporary Literary Criticism</a></span>  </div>  
  <div class="edit-link">        <span></span>  </div>  </div>

                              <div id="nav-search" class="nav-search"> <div class="region region-search-box clearfix">
  <div id="block-search-form" class="clearfix block block-search" role="search">       <div class="content"> <form action="/degree-programs/undergraduate-programs/digital-humanities-minor/digital-humanities-minor" method="post" id="search-block-form" accept-charset="UTF-8"><div><div class="container-inline">
      <h2 class="element-invisible">Search form</h2>
    <div class="form-item form-type-textfield form-item-search-block-form">
  <label class="element-invisible" for="edit-search-block-form--2">Search </label>

  <div id="block-menu-block-stanford-jumpstart-layouts-2" class="clearfix block block-menu-block">     <h2><a href="/degree-programs" class="active-trail">Degree Programs</a></h2>

<div id="block-bean-info-for-callout" class="clearfix block block-bean well more-link-stacked">     <h2>Information for Current and Prospective Students</h2>
      <div class="content"> <div class="entity entity-bean bean-stanford-postcard clearfix" about="/block/info-for-callout" typeof="">

  <div class="content">
    <div id="bean-stanford-postcard-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="bean-stanford-postcard-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-postcard-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><p>Are you a current or prospective student in the Department of English? Visit our info-for pages to learn about advising, download forms, and find other resources pertinent to you.</p>
</div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-postcard-link field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://sites.stanford.edu/english/information-for/undergraduates" class="more-link">Info for Undergraduates</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/english/information-for/graduates" class="more-link">Info for Ph.D. Students</a></div><div class="field-item even"><a href="https://sites.stanford.edu/english/information-for/prospective-graduates" class="more-link">Info for Prospective Ph.D. Students</a></div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
 </div>
