          <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Digital Humanities Minor </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <article id="node-9989" class="node node-stanford-page clearfix" about="/degree-programs/undergraduate-programs/digital-humanities-minor/digital-humanities-minor" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document">      <span property="dc:title" content="Digital Humanities Minor" class="rdf-meta element-hidden"></span>    <div class="content">
    <div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard" class="postcard group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-image" class="postcard-image group-s-postcard-image field-group-div"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-large-scaled field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/37257" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div id="field-collection-item-field-s-image-info-stanford-large-scaled-group-s-image-border-style" class="  group-s-image-border-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/large-scaled/public/smalldhminorposter_0.jpg?itok=LGif4ok-" width="270" height="147" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-page-full-group-s-postcard-content" class="postcard-content group-s-postcard-content field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded"><p class="lead">The important and flourishing field of Digital Humanities offers an exciting opportunity to expand the range of inquiry and invigorate interest in humanistic study among Stanford's undergraduates. This new Humanities and Sciences minor is pioneering in both the content of the institution--emphasizing the intersection of technology, computational analysis, new media, and traditional interpretive modes--as well as in the integrated cross-departmental nature of the course of study. The minor in Digital Humanites aims to provide a comprehensive educational system emphasizing the complementary and synergy of scientific and computational methods with humanites practices such as interpretation, critical thinking, and aesthetic creation. </p>
<h2>Structure of the Minor: A Three-Cluster Approach</h2>
<p>The minor consists of three clusters: Geospatial Humanities, Quantitative Textual Analysis, and Text Technologies. Students may choose to specialize in one of these areas.</p>
<h3>Geospatial Humanities</h3>
<p>Ranging from theory (space as a category of analysis) to technical representation/analysis of spatial distribution through algorithms, geospatial humanities can draw upon anthropology, geography, and other disciplines with a tradition of interest in space; meanwhile, it can feed into (for instance) literary studies.</p>
<h3>Quantitative Textual Analysis</h3>
<p>Quantitative Textual Analysis includes anything that uses computers to quantify formal properties of texts, ranging from word frequencies to chapter division to character networks. Genre, authorship, sentiment analysis, "opinion mining"--all of these can play a role. It intersects with linguistics/NLP; Classics and Cognitive Psychology can also be allies.</p>
<h3>Text Technologies</h3>
<p>Text Technologies encompasses technologies of communication; social media analysis; database creation, coding, TEI; technologies of publishing and text access; digital curation of virtual exhibitions (which allows us to bring in the arts, digital imagining, etc.)</p>
<h2>Requirements</h2>
<p>Students must take a minimum of twenty units: at least one core course (5 units), and at least five other courses of at least three credits each. Students complete twenty or more units in courses relevant to the major in departments across the university including Anthropology, Art, Communications, Computer Science, East Asian Languages and Cultures, Engineering, English, French, History, Italian, Linguistics, Music, Philosophy, Religious Studies, and Theatre and Performance. These electives are to be determined in consultation with the advisor to the Minor (a faculty member in English).</p>
<ol><li>Required introductory course (5 units). Students must take at least one of the following: "Introduction to Quantitative Textual Analysis", "Introduction to Geospatial Humanities"or "Text Tochnologies".. Some advanced courses might require skills' prerequisties, and students will be advised to take their chosen core course as soon as possible in their program of study.</li>
	<li>Concentration (5 courses, taken for at least 3 units each). Students may choose to concentrate in one of the three existing tracks. Students may fulfill the requirement with courses relevant to the minor in departments across the university including Anthropology, Art, Communications, Computer Science, East Asian Languages and Cultures, Engineering, English, French, History, Italian, Linguistics, Music, Philosophy, Religious Studies, and Theatre and Performance. These electives are to be determined in consultation with the advisor to the Minor (a faculty member in English).</li>
</ol><p>All of the core courses are designed to fulfill the Ways requirement for Social Inquiry and Quantitative Reasoning; or Social Inquiry and Interpretative and Aesthetic Inquiry; or Creative Expression and Social Inquiry or Quantitative Reasoning. At the center of these courses is the requirement that digital skills are acquired and demonstrated, alongside the understanding that Digital Humanities seeks not simply to highlight tools and approaches, but also to create new knowledge using these novel methods.</p>
<hr /><h3>Resources</h3>
<p><a href="https://dhminor.stanford.edu/">DH Website</a></p>
<p><a href="https://dhminor.stanford.edu/dh-courses">DH Courses</a></p>
<h3>Contact Information</h3>
<p><a href="https://dhminor.stanford.edu/people">DH Faculty College</a></p>
<p> </p>
</div></div></div></div></div>  </div>
    </article>  </div>
                                                                                                                                          </div>

            <div class="view-header">
      <h2>Department Bookshelf</h2>
<p>English remains a top-ranked department nationally because of the strength and variety of our faculty publications, both in scholarly research and creative writing. Browse the Bookshelf to explore our many interests.</p>    </div>

          <div id="content" class="mc-content span9">
            <div id="content-wrapper" class="content-wrapper">
              <div id="content-head" class="row-fluid content-head">
                <div id="highlighted" class="clearfix"></div>
                                                <h1 class="title" id="page-title"> Category: Courses </h1>
                                                                <div class="tabs">  </div>
                                                                              </div>
                                                        <div id="content-body" class="row-fluid content-body"> <div class="view view-stanford-taxonomy-term view-id-stanford_taxonomy_term view-display-id-page views-row-lines view-dom-id-4b6433203ee15d6039dd01a874ce0127">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first">
    <div  about="/news/gavin-jones-takes-closer-more-critical-examination-american-novelist-john-steinbeck" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="ds-1col node node-stanford-news-item view-mode-taxonomy clearfix">

  
  <div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard" class="postcard-left group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard-col1" class=" group-s-postcard-col1 field-group-div"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-square field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/39737" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div id="field-collection-item-field-s-image-info-stanford-small-square-group-s-image-border-style" class=" group-s-image-border-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-square/public/jones_0.jpg?itok=E8qcBub3" width="100" height="100" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard-col2" class=" group-s-postcard-col2 field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard-date-style" class="descriptor group-s-postcard-date-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-news-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2017-08-14T00:00:00-07:00">August 14, 2017</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-news-source field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://news.stanford.edu/">Stanford News</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="dc:title"><h3><a href="/news/gavin-jones-takes-closer-more-critical-examination-american-novelist-john-steinbeck">Gavin Jones takes a closer, more critical examination of American novelist John Steinbeck</a></h3></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded">John Steinbeck's life, work, and interdisciplinary interests are re-examined 115 years after his birth in Salinas, California.</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-news-categories-style" class="descriptor descriptor-btn group-s-news-categories-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-news-categories field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="/news/courses" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel" datatype="" class="active">Courses</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="/news/faculty" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel" datatype="">Faculty</a></div><div class="field-item even"><a href="/news/undergraduate" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel" datatype="">Undergraduate</a></div></div></div></div></div></div></div>

  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even">
    <div  about="/news/mythbusting-americas-west" typeof="sioc:Item foaf:Document" class="ds-1col node node-stanford-news-item view-mode-taxonomy clearfix">

  
  <div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard--2" class="postcard-left group-s-postcard field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard-col1--2" class=" group-s-postcard-col1 field-group-div"><div class="field-collection-container clearfix"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-info field-type-field-collection field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><div class="field-collection-view clearfix view-mode-stanford-small-square field-collection-view-final"><div class="entity entity-field-collection-item field-collection-item-field-s-image-info clearfix" about="/field-collection/field-s-image-info/36097" typeof="">
  <div class="content">
    <div id="field-collection-item-field-s-image-info-stanford-small-square-group-s-image-border-style--2" class=" group-s-image-border-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-image-image field-type-image field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://english.stanford.edu/sites/default/files/styles/sm-square/public/ja15_fr-west-map_gv2_225px.jpg?itok=eehNOnl3" width="100" height="100" alt="" /></div></div></div></div>  </div>
</div>
</div></div></div></div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard-col2--2" class=" group-s-postcard-col2 field-group-div"><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-postcard-date-style--2" class="descriptor group-s-postcard-date-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-news-date field-type-datetime field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2015-07-13T00:00:00-07:00">July 13, 2015</span></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-field-s-news-source field-type-link-field field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="http://alumni.stanford.edu">Stanford Alumni</a></div></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="dc:title"><h3><a href="/news/mythbusting-americas-west">Mythbusting America&#039;s West</a></h3></div></div></div><div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even" property="content:encoded">If you pick classes as if you're choosing from menus, The American West is where you go for fusion. Besides blending history, geography and...</div></div></div><div id="node-stanford-news-item-taxonomy-group-s-news-categories-style--2" class="descriptor descriptor-btn group-s-news-categories-style field-group-div"><div class="field field-name-field-s-news-categories field-type-taxonomy-term-reference field-label-hidden"><div class="field-items"><div class="field-item even"><a href="/news/courses" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel" datatype="" class="active">Courses</a></div><div class="field-item odd"><a href="/news/external-article" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel" datatype="">External Article</a></div><div class="field-item even"><a href="/news/faculty" typeof="skos:Concept" property="rdfs:label skos:prefLabel" datatype="">Faculty</a></div></div></div></div></div></div></div>
